page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN WALLINGTON
page.content: In the Beddington area there is a large area of open ground around which are "A" and "B" roads forming the skel- eton of the road transport of the area. Branches off these roads lead to the built-up area. The Croydon Road, which passes through the south of Beddington, is the main link between Croydon and Sutton. Between these two towns a bus service provides a link for shoppers, the buses being the 408 and 403. There are also other bus routes such as the 127 between Hackbridge and Selsdon. There was a proposal in about 1976 to continue the M23(to Brighton) to the centre of London, which would have run through the old Queen Elizabeth's Woods and then through the sewage farm, but the idea was abandoned. There are three British Rail stat- ions in the area which provide an imp- ortant commuter link with London.
